module.p: gu ruige up to, as far as, until is akin to a prepositional compound, with the difference being that the ‘complement’ is in the nominative case (rather than the genitive).

Spatial uses of gu ruige (right) up to, as far as emphasise that the (eventual) destination is non-intentional or unimportant compared with the trajectory (or the activity) itself. For example, the destination could be an accidental or intermediate point in the activity as a whole –
Chaidh iad ’nan ruith gu ruige an drochaid. They ran as far as the bridge.
Chaidh iad romhpa gu ruige an druim.
They went on as far as the ridge. td 223
Thàinig na tuilltean gu ruige an taigh.
The floods came (right) up to the house. td 223
gu ruige Èirinn
as far as Ireland td. 494

In its temporal uses, gu ruige up to, until introduces a bounding adverbal – converting an imperfective situation into a perfective one –
Tha i air fòrladh gu ruige deireadh a’ mhìosa. She is on leave right up to the end of the month.
Bidh sinn trang gu ruige a’ Bhliadhna Ùr.
We’ll be busy until / (right) up to New Year. td. 223

gu ruige seo until now, up to now, to date, so far –
Cha do rinn sinn mearachdan gu ruige seo.
We haven’t made any mistakes so far / up to now. td. 223
Shaoileadh duine bho na chaidh a ràdh gu ruige seo gu ...
One would think from what has been said so far that ... td. 494
uaithe sin gu ruige seo
from then till now td. 494
